messaging

Class Endpoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • messaging.Endpoint

  • public class Endpoint
extends java.lang.Object
    Endpoint is a class that provides message-based sending and receiving functionality. An endpoint has a InetSocketAddress that consists of its hostname and a port number, see the Javadoc of the Java platform libraries.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Endpoint()
      Creates a new end point with a system chosen port number.
      Endpoint(int port)
      Creates a new end point with a given port number.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Message blockingReceive()
      Reads and returns a message.
      Message nonBlockingReceive()
      Reads and returns a message, if there is one currently waiting for reading, otherwise this operation returns null.
      void send(java.net.InetSocketAddress receiver, java.io.Serializable payload)
      Sends a message with the payload payload to the receiver receiver.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Endpoint

        public Endpoint()
        Creates a new end point with a system chosen port number. Typically used on the client side whose port number need not be known.

      • Endpoint

        public Endpoint(int port)
        Creates a new end point with a given port number. Typically used on the server side whose port number need to be known to clients.
        Parameters:
        port - port number

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public void send(java.net.InetSocketAddress receiver,
        java.io.Serializable payload)
        Sends a message with the payload payload to the receiver receiver. The payload must be serializable, i.e. an instance of a serializable class.
        Parameters:
        receiver - receiver
        payload - payload

      • blockingReceive

        public Message blockingReceive()
        Reads and returns a message. If no message currently waits for reading, this operation blocks until a message arrives at this endpoint. return message

      • nonBlockingReceive

        public Message nonBlockingReceive()
        Reads and returns a message, if there is one currently waiting for reading, otherwise this operation returns null. return message, null if none pending
